sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Block after block of flattened homes and businesses, blackened hulks of burnt-out cars, the pavement streaked with melted chrome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The death toll from wildfires on Hawaii's Maui has risen to 67, as officials seek to determine how the inferno spread so rapidly with little warning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: People are found in houses, in a huddledle holding each other because the fire surrounded their homes before they could even get out. There was nowhere to go and these are beautiful homes that are very old and they're made of wood. Those went up like a matchstick. Nobody had morning. Fueled by dry conditions, hot temperatures and strong winds from a passing hurricane, at least three wildfires erupted on Maui this week racing through parched bush covering the island.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thousands have been displaced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Since Tuesday, aid organizations and community-led groups have mobilized to provide assistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 100 trucks bound for Niger, blocked in Malanville, the border town between Benin and Niger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The blockage has been going on for more than a week after Benin closed its borders with the embattled country, following a decision by the Economic Community of West African States. We left our families to go and have something to feed our families. We don't know what's going on. We're stuck here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We're going to be here for about 16 days today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So we ask the African population to solve their problems, to let us go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We're going to unload our luggage and return to our families calmly, as they should.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tensions are escalating between Niger's new military regime and the West African Regional Bloc that has ordered the deployment of troops to restore Niger's failing democracy. Hundreds of people have marched towards the French military base in the army, waving Russian flags and screaming down with France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After weeks of increased Russian attacks on Ukrainian facilities vital for grain shipments, Після тижнів високих російських атак на українські фасиліти, які важливі для виробництва гранату, Київ зазначив, що планує створити, що вона називає, гуманітарний коридор у Блакому Сі, який дозволить карго-шипам, які були залишені в портах, після Росії, втратитися. cancelled a landmark grain deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow claims to have improved its fighting positions in the northeast of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: These pictures show its soldiers training in the Kemerovo region in Serbia. This as Ukrainian citizens take part in a five-day course on civil defense. Open to men and women of any profession, it teaches techniques for handling weapons and first aid as Russia's relentless war rages on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Reverend Koval leads one of his first services in Turkey after the Russian Orthodox Church

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: decided to defrock him last September following his prayer for peace in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Putin ordered Russia's clergymen to pray for victory in the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But Reverend Koval replaced the word victory with peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In February, Reverend Kordoshkin was suspended for three months in Madrid for his stance against the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think that we have a duty to speak out, whatever the cost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But of course I cannot call my brethren who are in Russia to put themselves under threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Russian Orthodox Church explains the repressions as punishment for their so-called engagement in politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Co-hosts Australia have reached the Women's World Cup semi-finals for the first time,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: beating France in an agonizing penalty shootout in Brisbane.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Matildas will now play England after the Lionesses defeated Colombia 2-1. England advanced to the last four for the third consecutive Women's World Cup despite going into the tournament with a host of key players out injured. In next week's semi-finals, Spain and Sweden are up first on Tuesday and the Matildas will face the Lionesses in Sydney next Wednesday.
